results.title: Abraham Lincoln. - 2nd edition.
results.creator_credit: Scott Craig, Scott Craig Productions and Kathy Tallon
results.brief_description: Beginning with the statement that Lincoln became the “last victim of the Civil War”, when he was assassinated, the film traces his life from humble beginnings in a log cabin, an axe wielding woodsman and also voracious reader as a youth, to candidate to the State Assembly at twenty-three in 1832. However, the film gives no hint of criticism of Lincoln, who spoke “with courage and conviction for all people”, and no analysis of the causes of events or action is attempted.

results.title: Abraham Lincoln and the emancipation proclamation
results.creator_credit: Jesse Sandler, Project Seven Productions and Robert Gordon
results.brief_description: Examines the dilemma that confronted Abraham Lincoln over the issue of slavery. Traces the steps that led him to make his final decision.

results.title: Above New Zealand
results.brief_description: Take a look at New Zealand as you have never seen it before. Soaring like a bird in low altitude light aircraft and helicopters, swooping down from the clouds occasionally to watch New Zealanders at work and at play. From your viewpoint in the sky you will see the natural forces that shaped New Zealand’s rugged beauty still at work reshaping the land. The history of New Zealand’s Maori and Pakeha peoples also comes vividly alive. Rated: G

results.title: Above ground iron mine
results.creator_credit: King Screen Productions and Paul Preuss
results.brief_description: An old car reaches the end of the line mechanically, and is sent to the wreckers where it is ground into small bits of iron. These are sent to a smelter where it is processed into structural elements for buildings. We then see the owner of the first car driving a new car - beginning another cycle of use of materials.

results.title: About your body. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part film using animation and the setting of a doctor’s surgery to discuss the skeletal, muscular, nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems of the human body. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: About Trevelyan
results.creator_credit: Peter Scroggs, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to History”.
A discussion between four academic historians about the ways in which the discipline of history, as they study and teach it, makes demands which sharply differentiates it from other kinds of history. They relate these points in the first place to the virtues and defects of some of the work of G. M. Trevelyan. Then B. Dodson of York University, discusses a newspaper series called “The Making of the British” and shows five points at which it departs from what he would consider professional standards of history.

results.title: About time
results.creator_credit: Robert Marona, De Martin - Marona and Ed De Martin
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a girl and a tree she discovered as a child. Compares this relationship and the paradox of modern man caught in the time squeeze in order to point out the need for man to reorder his values concerning planet Earth.

results.title: About three hundred million years ago...
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Jean Hunt and James Allen
results.brief_description: Shows geologists collecting data to make a geological map and the subsequent laboratory work required to identify the structure and composition of the samples collected. Once the information is compiled, the map can be drawn and ideas about the geological history of the area can be formed. Narrated by Sydney Conabere and photographed by Don Whitehurst. Suitable for upper secondary level.
